title: overlay -180
name: overlay -180
description:
World map of interesting remote places, based on analysis of photos on <a href="http://www.panoramio.com/">Panoramio</a> and city locations on <a href="http://www.geonames.org/">GeoNames</a>.

<p>This map contains only remote places; i.e. there are no cities, no Eiffel tower etc. Color indicates touristiness. Touristy places are <font color="red"><b>red</b></font> (e.g. Greek islands). Extremely non-touristy places are <font color="green"><b>green</b></font>; these are often very remote locations where you are unlikely to meet any tourist for weeks (sections of Amazon basin). Places in between these extremes are <font color="yellow"><b>yellow</b></font> (for example Ladakh). Grey areas have no Panoramio photos or are not remote at all (New York City).

<p>For more information, see <a href="http://www.bluemoon.ee/~ahti/touristiness-map/">World touristiness map webpage</a>.

properties.name: Angel Falls, Venezuela
properties.description: Angel Falls is the worlds's highest waterfall with the height of 1054m. It is one of Venezuela's top tourist attractions, with guided tours and all, but access requires a flight to Canaima camp, plus 5h in a canoe, plus a 30-minute hike.

properties.name: Upsala glacier
properties.description: Upsala glacier is one of the most impressive glaciers in Patagonia. It is usually visited as a daytrip by boat from El Calafate. There are several other glaciers and lakes nearby.

properties.name: Valdes Peninsula
properties.description: is a UNESCO World Heritage nature reserve in Argentinean Patagonia. The peninsula is largely uninhabited. It is usually visited as a daytrip from Puerto Madryn, ca 100km away.

properties.name: Cape Horn
properties.description: Cape Horn is the southern tip of South America, and passing it is a major sailing challenge.

properties.name: Torres del Paine National Park
properties.description: Torres del Paine National Park is a major trekking area in Patagonia. Hundreds of trekkers per day arrive to the park in season. Access is a 4-hour bus ride from Puerto Natales.

properties.name: Moonscapes of southwest Bolivia
properties.description: This is an area of strange landscapes in altiplano, the high Andean desert. There is Salar de Uyuni, the worlds largest salt flat, 120km across; and many volcanoes, caves, and colored lakes. The area has no large settlements and almost no roads except for sandy 4wd tracks. Hundreds of tourists per day visit it on guided 4-day tours from Uyuni village.

properties.name: Annapurna massif
properties.description: The Annapurna massif is a popular trekking area in Nepal. There are very few motorable roads in Nepal, but Himalayan mountain valleys are well inhabited by villages connected with a network of walking trails. The area sees more than a thousand arriving tourists per day, some on daytrips, some on treks lasting several weeks.

properties.name: Mount Everest area
properties.description: Mount Everest and its surroundings are popular trekking and climbing destinations in Nepal. The area is fairly remote, with no motorable roads, but nonetheless it sees hundreds of trekkers per day, and the Everest climbing scene is called a circus by many people.

properties.name: Jiuzhaigou Valley
properties.description: Jiuzhaigou Valley is a UNESCO World Heritage nature reserve in central China.

properties.name: Tanggula Pass
properties.description: Tanggula Pass is the highest point on Beijing-Lhasa highway. The pass is at 5321m, and the worlds highest railway pass is nearby. The stretch through Tibet offers ample supply of lonely mountainous steppe views.

properties.name: Kebnekaise
properties.description: Kebnekaise is Sweden's highest peak at 2104m. Swedish Lapland has one inhabitant per square kilometre, so it is fairly lonely area, but there are plenty of hikers on marked trails near Kebnekaise. It is 70km from the peak to nearest town, Kiruna, which is also home to Spaceport Sweden.

properties.name: GR20 trail, Corsica
properties.description: The GR20 is one of the toughest hiking paths in Europe, with 10,000m of total altitude gain and 2 weeks typical hiking time. Corsica is the most mountainous of Mediterranean islands.

properties.name: Scottish highlands
properties.description: The Scottish highlands are rugged and sparsely populated mountainous areas in northern Scotland.

properties.name: Matsalu
properties.description: Matsalu is a major stop on East Atlantic Flyway, which is used by millions of birds annually. Tourism consists of mostly bird enthusiasts. With 1-2h drive from the national capital, it is not a particularly remote area.

properties.name: Concordia
properties.description: Concordia is a confluence of two large glaciers in Karakoram mountains of Pakistan. Four of the worlds 14 highest peaks are nearby, and in season the climbers camp in Concordia. It takes 4 days trekking to reach Concordia from nearest roadhead.

properties.name: Argentinean Puna de Atacama
properties.description: Similar scenery as in southwest Bolivia, but 100 times fewer tourists and tourism infrastructure. There are 1200 people in an area as large as Belgium. Access is by private 4x4 only. Some local villagers offer accommodation and guide services; no major hotels or mass tourism.

properties.name: Kailash
properties.description: Kailash is a sacred peak in Tibet. Every year, thousands of Buddhists and Hindus make the pilgrimage walk around the mountain.

properties.name: Narodnaya
properties.description: Narodnaya is the highest mountain in Ural range, on the border of Europe and Asia. Take a trin from Moscow to Petchora (2 days), then hydrofoil your way 100km to Aranets village, then walk for 2 days. Or approach on skis along the frozen rivers in winter.

properties.name: Ciudad Encantada
properties.description: Ciudad Encantada is a site of distinctive rock formations. There are tons of visitors on weekends, but the countryside and nearby villages are pretty.

properties.name: Antarctica
properties.description: Nowadays there are many cruise ships visiting this region of Antarctica from Ushuaia, Argentina. Prices start at $7000.

properties.name: Sarek
properties.description: The Sarek National Park is Europe's largest unspoiled wilderness outside Russia. There are no roads and no marked hiking trails. Weather is usually bad and you are on your own in many ways.
